Recitation.name: Recitation
Recitation.flavor: You echo your allies’ prayers to give them strength.
keywords: Zone
Recitation.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. When you move, the zone moves with you, remaining centered on you. While within the zone, your allies gain a +1 power bonus to attack rolls.

Agile Recovery.name: Agile Recovery
Agile Recovery.flavor: With a quick leap, you are back on your feet and ready to act.

Dodge Step.name: Dodge Step
Dodge Step.flavor: Relying on superior balance and agility, you move in the blink of an eye.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An enemy ends its turn adjacent to you

Effect: You shift 1 square.
Dodge Step.trigger: An enemy ends its turn adjacent to you

Rapid Escape.name: Rapid Escape
Rapid Escape.flavor: You suddenly slip from your enemy’s grasp, leaving it briefly vulnerable to your attacks.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must be grabbed

Effect: You make an Acrobatics check to escape. If the check succeeds and a creature was grabbing you, the creature grants combat advantage to you until the end of your turn.
Rapid Escape.effect: You make an Acrobatics check to escape. If the check succeeds and a creature was grabbing you, the creature grants combat advantage to you until the end of your turn.

Arcane Mutterings.name: Arcane Mutterings
Arcane Mutterings.flavor: You launch into a recitation of obscure lore on a subject to impress, cow, or trick your audience.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You would make a Bluff, a Diplomacy, or an Intimidate check

Effect: You make an Arcana check in place of the Bluff, Diplomacy, or Intimidate check.
Arcane Mutterings.trigger: You would make a Bluff, a Diplomacy, or an Intimidate check
Arcane Mutterings.effect: You make an Arcana check in place of the Bluff, Diplomacy, or Intimidate check.

Insightful Warning.name: Insightful Warning
Insightful Warning.flavor: As your foe unleashes its attack, you realize that you have read about this sort of danger and shout a warning to your friends.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: A creature you can see makes an attack roll for an area or a close attack that includes you as a target

Effect: You and each ally included as a target of the triggering attack gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against it.
Insightful Warning.trigger: A creature you can see makes an attack roll for an area or a close attack that includes you as a target
Insightful Warning.effect: You and each ally included as a target of the triggering attack gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against it.

Elemental Countermeasures.name: Elemental Countermeasures
Elemental Countermeasures.flavor: As magical energy streaks toward you, you use your knowledge of that magic to counter some of it.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage

Effect: You make an Arcana check. The damage is reduced by the check result divided by 2.
Elemental Countermeasures.trigger: You take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage
Elemental Countermeasures.effect: You make an Arcana check. The damage is reduced by the check result divided by 2.

Bounding Leap.name: Bounding Leap
Bounding Leap.flavor: As you spring through the air, you tuck in your legs and arms, spinning to eke out a little extra distance.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You make an Athletics check to jump with a +5 power bonus. You are considered to have a running start, and the distance you jump can exceed your speed.
Bounding Leap.effect: You make an Athletics check to jump with a +5 power bonus. You are considered to have a running start, and the distance you jump can exceed your speed.

Scrambling Climb.name: Scrambling Climb
Scrambling Climb.flavor: You use your forward momentum to help pull yourself upward.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You make an Athletics check to climb with a +5 power bonus. If the check succeeds, you climb a number of squares equal to 2 + your speed.
Scrambling Climb.effect: You make an Athletics check to climb with a +5 power bonus. If the check succeeds, you climb a number of squares equal to 2 + your speed.

Mighty Sprint.name: Mighty Sprint
Mighty Sprint.flavor: Your throw yourself forward at a breakneck pace, bounding over obstacles.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You move your speed + 4. During this movement, you ignore difficult terrain and gain a +5 power bonus to Athletics checks you make as part of the move.
Mighty Sprint.effect: You move your speed + 4. During this movement, you ignore difficult terrain and gain a +5 power bonus to Athletics checks you make as part of the move.

Battle Feint.name: Battle Feint
Battle Feint.flavor: Your sudden move causes the enemy to flinch, setting up your ally’s next attack.
keywords:
Melee 1

Target: One creature

Effect: You make a Bluff check opposed by the target’s passive Insight check. If the check succeeds, one ally adjacent to you gains combat advantage against the target for that ally’s next attack against it before the end of your next turn.
Battle Feint.effect: You make a Bluff check opposed by the target’s passive Insight check. If the check succeeds, one ally adjacent to you gains combat advantage against the target for that ally’s next attack against it before the end of your next turn.

Confusing Blather.name: Confusing Blather
Confusing Blather.flavor: You spew a stream of nonsense, leaving your enemies puzzled.
keywords:
Close burst 1

Target: Each enemy in the burst

Effect: You make a Bluff check opposed by each target’s passive Insight check. If the check succeeds against a target, that target cannot make opportunity attacks against you until the end of your next turn.
Confusing Blather.effect: You make a Bluff check opposed by each target’s passive Insight check. If the check succeeds against a target, that target cannot make opportunity attacks against you until the end of your next turn.

Improvisational Arcana.name: Improvisational Arcana
Improvisational Arcana.flavor: As you perform a ritual, you intersperse made-up words and improvise components, using odds and ends at hand.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are performing a ritual of one-half your level or lower

Effect: You expend only half of the ritual’s gold piece component cost (any focus item must still meet the minimum cost), although you cannot use this power to reduce the component cost of the rituals Brew Potion and Enchant Magic Item. You can also make a Bluff check in place of any skill check the ritual requires.
Improvisational Arcana.trigger: You are performing a ritual of one-half your level or lower
Improvisational Arcana.effect: You expend only half of the ritual’s gold piece component cost (any focus item must still meet the minimum cost), although you cannot use this power to reduce the component cost of the rituals Brew Potion and Enchant Magic Item. You can also make a Bluff check in place of any skill check the ritual requires.

Soothing Words.name: Soothing Words
Soothing Words.flavor: The battle done, your allies turn to you for words of encouragement and support.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Requirement: You must be taking a short rest

Target: Each ally who can hear you in the burst

Effect: When each target spends one or more healing surges at the end of the short rest, he or she regains additional hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.
Soothing Words.requirement: You must be taking a short rest
Soothing Words.target: Each ally who can hear you in the burst
Soothing Words.effect: When each target spends one or more healing surges at the end of the short rest, he or she regains additional hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

Haggle.name: Haggle
Haggle.flavor: You are a practiced negotiator, sometimes able to turn a slip of the tongue to your advantage.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make a Diplomacy check and dislike the result

Effect: You reroll the Diplomacy check and use either result.
Haggle.trigger: You make a Diplomacy check and dislike the result
Haggle.effect: You reroll the Diplomacy check and use either result.

Cry for Mercy.name: Cry for Mercy
Cry for Mercy.flavor: With pleading words and gestures, you discourage your enemies from striking down the wounded.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Target: You or one ally in the burst; the target must be bloodied

Effect: Until the end of your next turn or until the target is no longer bloodied, the target’s movement does not provoke opportunity attacks, and the target gains a +4 power bonus to all defenses.
Cry for Mercy.target: You or one ally in the burst; the target must be bloodied
Cry for Mercy.effect: Until the end of your next turn or until the target is no longer bloodied, the target’s movement does not provoke opportunity attacks, and the target gains a +4 power bonus to all defenses.

Otherworldly Lore.name: Otherworldly Lore
Otherworldly Lore.flavor: Something about the aberrant horror’s movements strikes a chord; you know just how to fight it.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Target: One aberrant creature you can see in the burst

Effect: You make a Dungeoneering monster knowledge check to determine the target’s resistances and vulnerabilities. If the check succeeds, you or one ally who can hear you gains a +4 power bonus to his or her next attack roll against the target before the end of your next turn.
Otherworldly Lore.target: One aberrant creature you can see in the burst
Otherworldly Lore.effect: You make a Dungeoneering monster knowledge check to determine the target’s resistances and vulnerabilities. If the check succeeds, you or one ally who can hear you gains a +4 power bonus to his or her next attack roll against the target before the end of your next turn.

Eyes of the Deep Delver.name: Eyes of the Deep Delver
Eyes of the Deep Delver.flavor: Long hours of working in dimness allow you to focus your senses for a moment to see in utter darkness.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You gain blindsight 10 until the end of your next turn.
Eyes of the Deep Delver.effect: You gain blindsight 10 until the end of your next turn.

Trap Sense.name: Trap Sense
Trap Sense.flavor: As the trap springs, your experience in dealing with such hazards lets you step aside and leave a foe at the trap’s mercy.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: A trap or a hazard makes a melee or a ranged attack roll against you

Effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses against the attack. If the attack misses you, the trap repeats the attack as a free action against an enemy adjacent to you.
Trap Sense.trigger: A trap or a hazard makes a melee or a ranged attack roll against you
Trap Sense.effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses against the attack. If the attack misses you, the trap repeats the attack as a free action against an enemy adjacent to you.

Endure Pain.name: Endure Pain
Endure Pain.flavor: You grin and bear it, shrugging off the pain of a new wound.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are hit by an attack

Effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain resistance to all damage equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier.
Endure Pain.trigger: You are hit by an attack
Endure Pain.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain resistance to all damage equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier.

Inspiring Fortitude.name: Inspiring Fortitude
Inspiring Fortitude.flavor: Inspired by your resilience, your allies find the will to overcome challenges.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Requirement: Your second wind must be available for you to use

Target: Each ally in the burst

Effect: You use your second wind, and each target gains temporary hit points equal to 10 + your Constitution modifier.
Inspiring Fortitude.requirement: Your second wind must be available for you to use
Inspiring Fortitude.effect: You use your second wind, and each target gains temporary hit points equal to 10 + your Constitution modifier.

Diehard.name: Diehard
Diehard.flavor: Though blood pours from a dozen wounds, you refuse to lie down and die.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You drop to 0 hit points or fewer

Effect: Until you aren’t dying or until the end of the encounter, the dying condition doesn’t cause you to fall unconscious, but you are dazed.
Diehard.trigger: You drop to 0 hit points or fewer
Diehard.effect: Until you aren’t dying or until the end of the encounter, the dying condition doesn’t cause you to fall unconscious, but you are dazed.

Healer’s Gift.name: Healer’s Gift
Healer’s Gift.flavor: You tend to a fallen comrade and stave off death’s touch.
keywords: Healing
Healer’s Gift.effect: The target can spend a healing surge.

Swift Recovery.name: Swift Recovery
Swift Recovery.flavor: You address a companion’s most critical wounds to get him or her back into the battle.
keywords:
Melee 1

Target: One ally

Effect: The target can use his or her second wind without taking an action to do so.
Swift Recovery.effect: The target can use his or her second wind without taking an action to do so.

Time Out.name: Time Out
Time Out.flavor: You grant your comrade a moment of respite.
keywords:
Melee 1

Target: One ally

Effect: The target regains the use of second wind if he or she has already used it during this encounter.
Time Out.effect: The target regains the use of second wind if he or she has already used it during this encounter.

Historical Revelation.name: Historical Revelation
Historical Revelation.flavor: When your ally struggles to recall an important fact, you supply a story to nudge him or her onto the right path.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you makes a knowledge check and dislikes the result

Target: The triggering ally in the burst

Effect: The target rerolls the knowledge check and uses either result.
Historical Revelation.trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you makes a knowledge check and dislikes the result
Historical Revelation.target: The triggering ally in the burst
Historical Revelation.effect: The target rerolls the knowledge check and uses either result.

Tactician’s Measure.name: Tactician’s Measure
Tactician’s Measure.flavor: The enemies’ movements are similar to those used in a skirmish you once studied. You use knowledge of it to outmaneuver a foe.
keywords:
Melee 1

Trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you or to an ally adjacent to you

Target: You or the ally

Effect: The target shifts 1 square and gains a +2 bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.
Tactician’s Measure.trigger: An enemy enters a square adjacent to you or to an ally adjacent to you
Tactician’s Measure.effect: The target shifts 1 square and gains a +2 bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

Anticipate Maneuver.name: Anticipate Maneuver
Anticipate Maneuver.flavor: You read your opponent like an open book and outsmart it.
keywords:
Melee 1

Target: One creature

Effect: You make an Insight check opposed by a Bluff check that the target makes as a free action. If your check succeeds, the target grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.
Anticipate Maneuver.effect: You make an Insight check opposed by a Bluff check that the target makes as a free action. If your check succeeds, the target grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.

Prescient Maneuver.name: Prescient Maneuver
Prescient Maneuver.flavor: Your enemy moves, and you match its steps with a countermove.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An enemy within 5 squares of you moves willingly

Effect: You shift a number of squares equal to one-half your speed.
Prescient Maneuver.trigger: An enemy within 5 squares of you moves willingly
Prescient Maneuver.effect: You shift a number of squares equal to one-half your speed.

Insightful Comment.name: Insightful Comment
Insightful Comment.flavor: You assess the situation and offer words of advice that guide the conversation in a fruitful direction.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Target: You and each ally in the burst

Effect: Until the end of your next turn, each target gains a bonus to Bluff checks, Diplomacy checks, and Intimidate checks equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Insightful Comment.target: You and each ally in the burst
Insightful Comment.effect: Until the end of your next turn, each target gains a bonus to Bluff checks, Diplomacy checks, and Intimidate checks equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Ominous Threat.name: Ominous Threat
Ominous Threat.flavor: You draw your enemy’s attention to rest squarely on you.
keywords:
Melee 1

Trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack

Target: The enemy you hit

Effect: You mark the target until the end of your next turn. In addition, one ally marked by the target is no longer marked.
Ominous Threat.trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack
Ominous Threat.effect: You mark the target until the end of your next turn. In addition, one ally marked by the target is no longer marked.

Demoralize Foe.name: Demoralize Foe
Demoralize Foe.flavor: You spit an ugly threat at your adversary, making it think twice before it attacks you.
keywords: Fear
Demoralize Foe.trigger: You hit an enemy with a melee attack
Demoralize Foe.effect: The target takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

Snap Out of It.name: Snap Out of It
Snap Out of It.flavor: A smack across the face brings your ally back to his or her senses.
keywords:
Melee touch

Target: One ally subject to a dazing, dominating, or stunning effect that a save can end

Effect: The target makes a saving throw against the effect.
Snap Out of It.target: One ally subject to a dazing, dominating, or stunning effect that a save can end
Snap Out of It.effect: The target makes a saving throw against the effect.

Nature Sense.name: Nature Sense
Nature Sense.flavor: The forest is quiet . . . too quiet.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You would make an initiative check in a natural environment

Effect: You make a Nature check in place of your initiative check. In addition, you and your allies gain a +4 bonus to all defenses until the end of the first round of the encounter.
Nature Sense.trigger: You would make an initiative check in a natural environment
Nature Sense.effect: You make a Nature check in place of your initiative check. In addition, you and your allies gain a +4 bonus to all defenses until the end of the first round of the encounter.

Practiced Rider.name: Practiced Rider
Practiced Rider.flavor: So familiar are you with the saddle, you can spring to or from your mount in a flash.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You mount or dismount a willing, adjacent creature that has the mount keyword.
Practiced Rider.effect: You mount or dismount a willing, adjacent creature that has the mount keyword.

Spot the Path.name: Spot the Path
Spot the Path.flavor: Having walked miles of broken trails, you know how to find the safest way through the most treacherous terrain.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Target: You and each ally in the burst

Effect: : Each target ignores difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.
Spot the Path.target: You and each ally in the burst
Spot the Path.effect: : Each target ignores difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

Far Sight.name: Far Sight
Far Sight.flavor: You focus your senses to pick out enemies at the edge of your vision.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Until the end of your next turn, your ranged weapon attack rolls take no penalty from long range, and they ignore cover and concealment, but not superior cover or total concealment.
Far Sight.effect: Until the end of your next turn, your ranged weapon attack rolls take no penalty from long range, and they ignore cover and concealment, but not superior cover or total concealment.

Guided Shot.name: Guided Shot
Guided Shot.flavor: You spot a critical weakness in a foe’s defenses, which an ally can exploit to deadly effect.
keywords:
Close burst 10

Trigger: An ally within 10 squares of you misses with an attack against AC

Target: The triggering ally in the burst

Effect: The target’s attack is made against Reflex instead of AC.
Guided Shot.trigger: An ally within 10 squares of you misses with an attack against AC
Guided Shot.target: The triggering ally in the burst
Guided Shot.effect: The target’s attack is made against Reflex instead of AC.

Uncanny Instincts.name: Uncanny Instincts
Uncanny Instincts.flavor: Your keen senses guide your and your friend’s reactions.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Trigger: You roll initiative and dislike the result

Target: You and one ally in the burst

Effect: The targets use your passive Perception check in place of their initiative checks.
Uncanny Instincts.trigger: You roll initiative and dislike the result
Uncanny Instincts.target: You and one ally in the burst
Uncanny Instincts.effect: The targets use your passive Perception check in place of their initiative checks.

Faith Healing.name: Faith Healing
Faith Healing.flavor: Your prayers help an ally recover from injury.
keywords: Healing
Faith Healing.effect: The target can spend a healing surge.

Theologian’s Shield.name: Theologian’s Shield
Theologian’s Shield.flavor: Calling on lore culled from sacred texts, you know how to protect yourself from your enemy’s attack.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are hit by a necrotic or a radiant attack

Effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain necrotic resistance and radiant resistance equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier.
Theologian’s Shield.trigger: You are hit by a necrotic or a radiant attack
Theologian’s Shield.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain necrotic resistance and radiant resistance equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier.

Conviction.name: Conviction
Conviction.flavor: You whisper a prayer for aid to overcome hardship.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You gain a +5 bonus to the next saving throw you make before the start of your next turn.
Conviction.effect: You gain a +5 bonus to the next saving throw you make before the start of your next turn.

Obscured Avoidance.name: Obscured Avoidance
Obscured Avoidance.flavor: Although your enemy’s attention is on you, its inability to see you clearly can keep you out of harm’s way.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must be marked and have concealment from the creature that marked you

Effect: The marked condition ends on you.
Obscured Avoidance.requirement: You must be marked and have concealment from the creature that marked you
Obscured Avoidance.effect: The marked condition ends on you.

Concealed Shift.name: Concealed Shift
Concealed Shift.flavor: Your enemy misjudges your position, giving you a chance to duck out of the way.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An enemy misses you with a melee or a ranged attack while you have concealment or cover from it

Effect: You shift 1 square.
Concealed Shift.trigger: An enemy misses you with a melee or a ranged attack while you have concealment or cover from it

Crowd Cover.name: Crowd Cover
Crowd Cover.flavor: You keep your enemies between you and their companion, using them as a shield.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An enemy makes a ranged attack roll against you

Effect: Enemies adjacent to you and in the attack’s way grant cover to you against the attack. If the attack misses, the attacker rerolls it against one enemy that granted cover to you against it.
Crowd Cover.trigger: An enemy makes a ranged attack roll against you
Crowd Cover.effect: Enemies adjacent to you and in the attack’s way grant cover to you against the attack. If the attack misses, the attacker rerolls it against one enemy that granted cover to you against it.

City Rat.name: City Rat
City Rat.flavor: Like a rat, you are particularly skilled at using the environment, as well as your companions, to stay out of sight.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You end a move action and have cover against at least one creature

Effect: You make a Streetwise check in place of a Stealth check to become hidden from any creature against which you have cover.
City Rat.trigger: You end a move action and have cover against at least one creature
City Rat.effect: You make a Streetwise check in place of a Stealth check to become hidden from any creature against which you have cover.

Slow Pursuit.name: Slow Pursuit
Slow Pursuit.flavor: You knock over obstacles, take difficult paths, drop rubbish, and do anything else you can think of to slow your enemies’ pursuit.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must be in an urban environment

Effect: You move your speed. At one point during the movement, you create an area of difficult terrain in a close blast 3. The difficult terrain lasts until the end of the encounter.
Slow Pursuit.requirement: You must be in an urban environment
Slow Pursuit.effect: You move your speed. At one point during the movement, you create an area of difficult terrain in a close blast 3. The difficult terrain lasts until the end of the encounter.

Navigate Crowds.name: Navigate Crowds
Navigate Crowds.flavor: A life spent in the city trained you to maneuver through crowds.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You shift your speed. During this movement, you can move through enemies’ spaces.
Navigate Crowds.effect: You shift your speed. During this movement, you can move through enemies’ spaces.

Fast Hands.name: Fast Hands
Fast Hands.flavor: Your fingers blur as you manipulate objects faster than the eye can follow.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You draw or sheathe a weapon, pick up an item in your space or adjacent to it, or retrieve or stow an item

Special: You can use this power only once per round.
Fast Hands.effect: You draw or sheathe a weapon, pick up an item in your space or adjacent to it, or retrieve or stow an item
Fast Hands.special: You can use this power only once per round.

Stolen Defense.name: Stolen Defense
Stolen Defense.flavor: You make a move toward your foe, leading it to believe you just robbed it and giving your ally a chance to get the jump on it.
keywords:
Melee touch

Target: One creature

Effect: You make a Thievery check opposed by the target’s passive Perception check. If your check succeeds, the next ally who attacks the target before the end of your next turn gains combat advantage against it for that attack.
Stolen Defense.effect: You make a Thievery check opposed by the target’s passive Perception check. If your check succeeds, the next ally who attacks the target before the end of your next turn gains combat advantage against it for that attack.

Disruptive Stunt.name: Disruptive Stunt
Disruptive Stunt.flavor: With a flurry of taps, shoves, and nudges, you push past your foe, leaving it flustered.
keywords:
Melee 1

Target: One creature

Effect: You move your speed through the target’s space to a square adjacent to it. This movement does not provoke an opportunity attack from the target. In addition, the target takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
Disruptive Stunt.effect: You move your speed through the target’s space to a square adjacent to it. This movement does not provoke an opportunity attack from the target. In addition, the target takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

Perfect Recall.name: Perfect Recall
Perfect Recall.flavor: Your mind is a steel trap; nothing escapes it.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You would make an Intelligence check

Effect: You make a History check in place of the Intelligence check.
Perfect Recall.trigger: You would make an Intelligence check
Perfect Recall.effect: You make a History check in place of the Intelligence check.

Graceful Maneuver.name: Graceful Maneuver
Graceful Maneuver.flavor: You dodge past your enemies with speed and grace.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You shift half your speed.

Perfect Balance.name: Perfect Balance
Perfect Balance.flavor: No matter how narrow the path, you have the balance and coordination needed to walk it.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You move your speed - 2. During this movement, you ignore difficult terrain, and you can move across any horizontal surface that is at least 3 inches wide without making an Acrobatics check.
Perfect Balance.effect: You move your speed - 2. During this movement, you ignore difficult terrain, and you can move across any horizontal surface that is at least 3 inches wide without making an Acrobatics check.

Tumbling Dodge.name: Tumbling Dodge
Tumbling Dodge.flavor: You deftly tumble away from a strike.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: A melee attack hits you

Effect: You make an Acrobatics check and gain a bonus to all defenses against the triggering attack equal to the check result divided by 10. If the bonus causes the attack to miss, you shift 1 square.
Tumbling Dodge.effect: You make an Acrobatics check and gain a bonus to all defenses against the triggering attack equal to the check result divided by 10. If the bonus causes the attack to miss, you shift 1 square.

Drop and Roll.name: Drop and Roll
Drop and Roll.flavor: You fall off a ledge, but your training allows you to dash forward after landing safely.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You fall and take no damage

Effect: You shift 3 squares.
Drop and Roll.trigger: You fall and take no damage

Reflexive Dodge.name: Reflexive Dodge
Reflexive Dodge.flavor: As the attack explodes toward you, your reflexes allow you to remain one step ahead of it.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An area or a close attack hits you

Effect: You make an Acrobatics check and reduce the damage you take from the triggering attack by half the check result. You then shift half your speed.
Reflexive Dodge.trigger: An area or a close attack hits you
Reflexive Dodge.effect: You make an Acrobatics check and reduce the damage you take from the triggering attack by half the check result. You then shift half your speed.

Arcane Senses.name: Arcane Senses
Arcane Senses.flavor: You refocus your eyes to see magic energy invisible to the untrained eye, learning how many magical creatures are nearby.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You make an Arcana check and learn the number of elemental, fey, and shadow creatures that are within a number of squares of you equal to the check result. You don’t learn the creatures’ locations, but you do learn separate counts for each type.
Arcane Senses.effect: You make an Arcana check and learn the number of elemental, fey, and shadow creatures that are within a number of squares of you equal to the check result. You don’t learn the creatures’ locations, but you do learn separate counts for each type.

Experienced Arcana.name: Experienced Arcana
Experienced Arcana.flavor: You have discovered how to perform your magic rituals with fewer alchemical reagents than other magicians require.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are performing an Arcana ritual of one-half your level or lower

Effect: You expend only half of the ritual’s gold piece component cost (any focus item must still meet the minimum cost), although you cannot use this power to reduce the component cost of the rituals Brew Potion and Enchant Magic Item. If you make an Arcana check as part of the ritual and dislike the result, you can reroll the check with a +4 power bonus and use either result.
Experienced Arcana.trigger: You are performing an Arcana ritual of one-half your level or lower
Experienced Arcana.effect: You expend only half of the ritual’s gold piece component cost (any focus item must still meet the minimum cost), although you cannot use this power to reduce the component cost of the rituals Brew Potion and Enchant Magic Item. If you make an Arcana check as part of the ritual and dislike the result, you can reroll the check with a +4 power bonus and use either result.

Sudden Leap (Skill Power).name: Sudden Leap (Skill Power)
Sudden Leap (Skill Power).flavor: You spring around your enemy too quickly for it to strike you.
keywords:
Melee 1

Target: One creature

Effect: You make an Athletics check against a DC determined by the target’s size: 15 (Medium or smaller), 20 (Large), 25 (Huge), or 30 (Gargantuan). If the check succeeds, you jump to another square adjacent to the target, without provoking an opportunity attack from it.
Sudden Leap (Skill Power).effect: You make an Athletics check against a DC determined by the target’s size: 15 (Medium or smaller), 20 (Large), 25 (Huge), or 30 (Gargantuan). If the check succeeds, you jump to another square adjacent to the target, without provoking an opportunity attack from it.

Incredible Stride.name: Incredible Stride
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Until the stance ends, you gain a +4 power bonus to speed.
Incredible Stride.effect: Until the stance ends, you gain a +4 power bonus to speed.

False Bravado.name: False Bravado
False Bravado.flavor: Your apparent courage makes your enemy think twice about pressing its attack.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must be marked.

Effect: You are no longer marked.

Dirty Tricks.name: Dirty Tricks
Dirty Tricks.flavor: Using trickery, you create opportunities to evade capture.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You make a Bluff check opposed by an adjacent enemy’s passive Insight check. If the check succeeds, you move 1 square and don’t provoke an opportunity attack from that enemy.
Dirty Tricks.effect: You make a Bluff check opposed by an adjacent enemy’s passive Insight check. If the check succeeds, you move 1 square and don’t provoke an opportunity attack from that enemy.

Fast Talk.name: Fast Talk
Fast Talk.flavor: During a negotiation, your misstep becomes an opportunity to find your opponent’s weakness.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make a Bluff, a Diplomacy, or an Intimidate check and dislike the result

Effect: You make a Bluff check and use either result.
Fast Talk.trigger: You make a Bluff, a Diplomacy, or an Intimidate check and dislike the result
Fast Talk.effect: You make a Bluff check and use either result.

Stall Tactics.name: Stall Tactics
Stall Tactics.flavor: Your fast talking causes your enemies to hesitate for a crucial moment.
keywords:
Ranged sight

Trigger: You roll initiative

Target: Each enemy you can see

Effect: Each target’s initiative is reduced by 10.
Stall Tactics.effect: Each target’s initiative is reduced by 10.

Stirring Speech.name: Stirring Speech
Stirring Speech.flavor: Reciting your allies’ great deeds and talents, you fill them with the confidence they need to win a battle ahead.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Requirement: You must be taking a short rest.

Target: Each ally who can hear you in the burst

Effect: Until the end of the next encounter, each target gains a +1 bonus to attack rolls and saving throws while not bloodied.
Stirring Speech.requirement: You must be taking a short rest.
Stirring Speech.target: Each ally who can hear you in the burst
Stirring Speech.effect: Until the end of the next encounter, each target gains a +1 bonus to attack rolls and saving throws while not bloodied.

Befriend.name: Befriend
Befriend.flavor: You know the right things to say to make people like you.
keywords:
Ranged 5

Target: One nonhostile creature that has Intelligence 5 or higher

Effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +5 power bonus to Bluff checks and Diplomacy checks against the target.
Befriend.target: One nonhostile creature that has Intelligence 5 or higher
Befriend.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +5 power bonus to Bluff checks and Diplomacy checks against the target.

Noble Sacrifice.name: Noble Sacrifice
Noble Sacrifice.flavor: You demand that an enemy face you to distract it from your wounded friend, who is inspired by your sacrifice.
keywords: Charm
Noble Sacrifice.trigger: An enemy within 3 squares of you makes a melee attack roll against your bloodied ally adjacent to you
Noble Sacrifice.effect: The target’s attack roll is against you instead of the bloodied ally. If the attack hits you, the ally gains temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

Indomitable Ally.name: Indomitable Ally
Indomitable Ally.flavor: When you are near, your allies refuse to give up.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer by an attack

Target: The triggering ally in the burst

Effect: Until the end of the target’s next turn, the dying condition doesn’t cause the target to fall unconscious.
Indomitable Ally.trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer by an attack
Indomitable Ally.target: The triggering ally in the burst
Indomitable Ally.effect: Until the end of the target’s next turn, the dying condition doesn’t cause the target to fall unconscious.

Deep Shadows.name: Deep Shadows
Deep Shadows.flavor: Judging the play of shadows against the cave wall, you spot a hiding place that an untrained explorer would overlook.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must have cover or concealment underground.

Effect: You make a Dungeoneering check in place of a Stealth check to hide.
Deep Shadows.requirement: You must have cover or concealment underground.
Deep Shadows.effect: You make a Dungeoneering check in place of a Stealth check to hide.

Stonecunning.name: Stonecunning
Stonecunning.flavor: The subterranean world keeps few secrets from you.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You would make a Perception check underground

Effect: You make a Dungeoneering check in place of the Perception check.
Stonecunning.trigger: You would make a Perception check underground
Stonecunning.effect: You make a Dungeoneering check in place of the Perception check.

Third Wind.name: Third Wind
Third Wind.flavor: You have almost endless reserves and can rebound from injuries that would bring down another.
keywords: Healing
Third Wind.special: As a standard action, an adjacent ally can make a DC 10 Heal check to allow you to use this power without spending an action yourself.

Walk It Off.name: Walk It Off
Walk It Off.flavor: You take a deep breath to fight off a lingering wound.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: Your turn starts and you have ongoing damage

Effect: Make a saving throw against the ongoing damage before you take the damage.
Walk It Off.trigger: Your turn starts and you have ongoing damage
Walk It Off.effect: Make a saving throw against the ongoing damage before you take the damage.

Reactive Surge.name: Reactive Surge
Reactive Surge.flavor: The attack was well placed, but you choose not to let it affect you.
keywords: Healing

Delay Poison.name: Delay Poison
Delay Poison.flavor: Your ministrations briefly protect your patient from poison.
keywords:
Melee 1

Target: You or one creature

Effect: The target is immune to poison until the end of your next turn.
Delay Poison.effect: The target is immune to poison until the end of your next turn.

Physician's Care.name: Physician's Care
Physician's Care.flavor: Your extensive training helps you get an ally back into the fight.
keywords: Healing
Physician's Care.effect: The target can spend a healing surge.

Miraculous Treatment.name: Miraculous Treatment
Miraculous Treatment.flavor: Your expert care mends some wounds instantly.
keywords:
Melee 1

Target: One ally

Effect: The target regains hit points as if he or she had spent a healing surge.
Miraculous Treatment.effect: The target regains hit points as if he or she had spent a healing surge.

Legend Lore.name: Legend Lore
Legend Lore.flavor: Legends are your specialty, and you can always find a use for these stories.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You would make a knowledge check using a skill other than History

Effect: You make a History check in place of the knowledge check.
Legend Lore.trigger: You would make a knowledge check using a skill other than History
Legend Lore.effect: You make a History check in place of the knowledge check.

Strategist's Epiphany.name: Strategist's Epiphany
Strategist's Epiphany.flavor: Recalling ancient battles, you find their echoes in your enemies’ positions and use that knowledge to help your side in the battle.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You roll initiative

Effect: You make a History check and can use the check result as your initiative check result.
Strategist's Epiphany.effect: You make a History check and can use the check result as your initiative check result.

Empathic Read.name: Empathic Read
Empathic Read.flavor: You sense where the conversation is headed and stop an ally from making a gaffe.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Trigger: An ally fails a Bluff, a Diplomacy, or an Intimidate check

Target: The triggering ally in the burst

Effect: The target rerolls the skill check and uses either result.
Empathic Read.trigger: An ally fails a Bluff, a Diplomacy, or an Intimidate check
Empathic Read.target: The triggering ally in the burst
Empathic Read.effect: The target rerolls the skill check and uses either result.

Insightful Counter.name: Insightful Counter
Insightful Counter.flavor: You foresee your opponent’s move and deny it the advantage.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You do not grant combat advantage until the end of your next turn.
Insightful Counter.effect: You do not grant combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Prescient Defense.name: Prescient Defense
Prescient Defense.flavor: You anticipate your foe’s attack and ably defend yourself.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are hit by a creature

Effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against the attack.
Prescient Defense.trigger: You are hit by a creature
Prescient Defense.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against the attack.

Insightful Riposte.name: Insightful Riposte
Insightful Riposte.flavor: You predict how the enemy will react to your strike and account for it.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You miss with an attack

Effect: You gain a +3 power bonus to the attack roll.
Insightful Riposte.effect: You gain a +3 power bonus to the attack roll.

Everybody Move.name: Everybody Move
Everybody Move.flavor: You inspire terror in your enemies.
keywords: Fear
Everybody Move.effect: You push each target 1 square, but not into hindering terrain.

Try the Stick.name: Try the Stick
Try the Stick.flavor: Why waste time with diplomacy when threats can get to the heart of the matter?
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You would make a Diplomacy check

Effect: You make an Intimidate check in place of the Diplomacy check.
Try the Stick.trigger: You would make a Diplomacy check
Try the Stick.effect: You make an Intimidate check in place of the Diplomacy check.

Mounted Coordination.name: Mounted Coordination
Mounted Coordination.flavor: You synchronize your attack with your mount’s movements to maximize your damage.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must be mounted on a willing creature.

Effect: You gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll of your next attack before the start of your next turn.
Mounted Coordination.requirement: You must be mounted on a willing creature.
Mounted Coordination.effect: You gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll of your next attack before the start of your next turn.

Path of the Bounding Stag.name: Path of the Bounding Stag
Path of the Bounding Stag.flavor: You easily pick a path through the underbrush.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You move your speed. During this movement, you ignore difficult terrain that is a result of trees, underbrush, or other natural growth.
Path of the Bounding Stag.effect: You move your speed. During this movement, you ignore difficult terrain that is a result of trees, underbrush, or other natural growth.

Trapfinding.name: Trapfinding
Trapfinding.flavor: As a trap harries your allies, you swiftly scan the area, picking out the most likely location of the hidden control panel.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You find a trap with a Perception check

Effect: Until the end of the encounter, you can reroll Thievery checks to disable the trap. You must use the second result.
Trapfinding.trigger: You find a trap with a Perception check
Trapfinding.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you can reroll Thievery checks to disable the trap. You must use the second result.

Warning of Peril.name: Warning of Peril
Warning of Peril.flavor: Your keen senses notice the tiniest details, which you relay to your allies with a quick word of warning.
keywords: Stance
Warning of Peril.effect: Until the stance ends, allies who can see or hear you can use your passive Perception check in place of their own while they are within 5 squares of you. You do not grant this benefit while you are unconscious.

Focused Sight.name: Focused Sight
Focused Sight.flavor: The noise of battle grows faint, and the flash of blade and spell fades away, as you focus all your senses on your target.
keywords:
Ranged 10

Target: One creature

Effect: When you attack the target, you take no penalties to attack rolls because of cover, superior cover, concealment, or total concealment. This benefit lasts until the end of your next turn.
Focused Sight.effect: When you attack the target, you take no penalties to attack rolls because of cover, superior cover, concealment, or total concealment. This benefit lasts until the end of your next turn.

Perfect Sight.name: Perfect Sight
Perfect Sight.flavor: Enemies might hide, but once you find a trace of them, there’s no escaping you.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You gain blindsight 5 until the end of your next turn.
Perfect Sight.effect: You gain blindsight 5 until the end of your next turn.

Spot Weakness.name: Spot Weakness
Spot Weakness.flavor: You pinpoint a weakness and direct your next attack toward it.
keywords:
Ranged sight

Target: One creature

Effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +4 power bonus to your next damage roll against the target.
Spot Weakness.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +4 power bonus to your next damage roll against the target.

Censure the Unholy.name: Censure the Unholy
Censure the Unholy.flavor: Brandishing your holy symbol, you drive undead away and bolster your allies against them.
keywords: Zone
Censure the Unholy.requirement: You must be wearing or holding a holy symbol.
Censure the Unholy.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. When you move, the zone moves with you, remaining centered on you. While within the zone, your allies gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against undead creatures. If an undead creature ends its turn within the zone, you push it 1 square as a free action.

Shrouding Gloom.name: Shrouding Gloom
Shrouding Gloom.flavor: Using the environment agilely, you disappear from view.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must have cover or concealment.

Effect: You make a Stealth check.
Shrouding Gloom.requirement: You must have cover or concealment.

Persistent Tail.name: Persistent Tail
Persistent Tail.flavor: You follow your prey unseen, waiting for the best time to strike.
keywords:
Close burst 20

Target: One creature in the burst that you can see and that you have cover or concealment against

Effect: The first time the target moves before the start of your next turn, you can move your speed as an immediate reaction. If you end the movement with cover or concealment against the target, you can make a Stealth check to become hidden.
Persistent Tail.target: One creature in the burst that you can see and that you have cover or concealment against
Persistent Tail.effect: The first time the target moves before the start of your next turn, you can move your speed as an immediate reaction. If you end the movement with cover or concealment against the target, you can make a Stealth check to become hidden.

Deepening Gloom.name: Deepening Gloom
Deepening Gloom.flavor: Using the surroundings, you obscure yourself from your attacker.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An enemy hits you with a melee or a ranged attack and you have cover or concealment against it

Effect: You become invisible to the triggering enemy until the start of your next turn.
Deepening Gloom.trigger: An enemy hits you with a melee or a ranged attack and you have cover or concealment against it
Deepening Gloom.effect: You become invisible to the triggering enemy until the start of your next turn.

Nose for Trouble.name: Nose for Trouble
Nose for Trouble.flavor: Many years of life in cities have taught you to keep a close eye on your surroundings. When trouble breaks out, you’re ready for it.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You roll initiative and dislike the result

Effect: You make a Streetwise check, and you use either that check result or your initiative check result as your initiative.
Nose for Trouble.trigger: You roll initiative and dislike the result
Nose for Trouble.effect: You make a Streetwise check, and you use either that check result or your initiative check result as your initiative.

City Dweller.name: City Dweller
City Dweller.flavor: Your familiarity with cities tells you what will support your weight and helps you perceive things that are out of place.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You would make an Acrobatics, an Athletics, or a Perception check in an urban environment

Effect: You make a Streetwise check in place of the Acrobatics, Athletics, or Perception check.
City Dweller.trigger: You would make an Acrobatics, an Athletics, or a Perception check in an urban environment
City Dweller.effect: You make a Streetwise check in place of the Acrobatics, Athletics, or Perception check.

Lock Tap.name: Lock Tap
Lock Tap.flavor: A practiced tap is sometimes all it takes to pop open a lock.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You make a Thievery check to open an adjacent lock.
Lock Tap.effect: You make a Thievery check to open an adjacent lock.

Quick Palm.name: Quick Palm
Quick Palm.flavor: Through sleight of hand, you make the object disappear.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You make a Thievery check either to pick an adjacent pocket or to use sleight of hand.
Quick Palm.effect: You make a Thievery check either to pick an adjacent pocket or to use sleight of hand.

Hasty Retreat.name: Hasty Retreat
Hasty Retreat.flavor: It dawns on you as you botch the job that now might be a good time to make a swift exit.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: Your Thievery check triggers a trap

Effect: You shift a number of squares equal to half your Dexterity modifier.
Hasty Retreat.trigger: Your Thievery check triggers a trap
Hasty Retreat.effect: You shift a number of squares equal to half your Dexterity modifier.

Quick Switch.name: Quick Switch
Quick Switch.flavor: You pull your friend closer and then slip away.
keywords:
Melee 1

Target: One ally

Effect: You slide the target 1 square into your space. You then shift 1 square.
Quick Switch.effect: You slide the target 1 square into your space. You then shift 1 square.

Warp in the Weave.name: Warp in the Weave
Warp in the Weave.flavor: You spend energy and tap into the web of magic that connects everything, ready to create a few temporary holes.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must have at least 1 healing surge.

Trigger: A creature uses a burst or blast power that includes you

Effect: You spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. The triggering burst or blast does not target you or your square.
Warp in the Weave.requirement: You must have at least 1 healing surge.
Warp in the Weave.trigger: A creature uses a burst or blast power that includes you
Warp in the Weave.effect: You spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. The triggering burst or blast does not target you or your square.

Grit and Spittle.name: Grit and Spittle
Grit and Spittle.flavor: Drawing on pure stubbornness, you’re ready see your way through disaster.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must have at least 1 healing surge.

Effect: You spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. You make a saving throw against every effect on you that a save can end.
Grit and Spittle.requirement: You must have at least 1 healing surge.
Grit and Spittle.effect: You spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. You make a saving throw against every effect on you that a save can end.

Lessons of History.name: Lessons of History
Lessons of History.flavor: As you watch your allies, you draw upon past lessons to shout out a few pointers.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Requirement: You must have at least 1 healing surge.

Target: Each ally in the burst

Effect: You spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. Each target can regain one expended encounter utility power of level 10 or lower.
Lessons of History.requirement: You must have at least 1 healing surge.
Lessons of History.effect: You spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. Each target can regain one expended encounter utility power of level 10 or lower.

Nightshade Draught.name: Nightshade Draught
Nightshade Draught.flavor: As long as you survive the aftertaste, this concoction can keep you going on borrowed time.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are reduced to 0 hit points or fewer and don’t die

Effect: Dying does not cause you to fall unconscious until the end of your next turn. You automatically fail a death saving throw if you are still dying at the end of your next turn.

Sustain Minor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn, and you automatically fail a death saving throw if you are still dying at the end of your next turn.
Nightshade Draught.trigger: You are reduced to 0 hit points or fewer and don’t die
Nightshade Draught.effect: Dying does not cause you to fall unconscious until the end of your next turn. You automatically fail a death saving throw if you are still dying at the end of your next turn.
Nightshade Draught.sustainMinor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn, and you automatically fail a death saving throw if you are still dying at the end of your next turn.

Deliverance of Faith.name: Deliverance of Faith
Deliverance of Faith.flavor: You give of yourself in the belief that somewhere, something will give a little back.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. You gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value.
Deliverance of Faith.effect: You spend a healing surge but regain no hit points. You gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value.

Studied Casting.name: Studied Casting
Studied Casting.flavor: You catch an error at the last moment, correcting a malformed glyph before it can ruin your ritual.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make a skill check to perform a ritual and dislike the result.

Effect: Reroll the check with a +4 power bonus. You must use the second result.
Studied Casting.trigger: You make a skill check to perform a ritual and dislike the result.
Studied Casting.effect: Reroll the check with a +4 power bonus. You must use the second result.

Practiced Mental Defense.name: Practiced Mental Defense
Practiced Mental Defense.flavor: Your experience with unnatural mental influences has taught you how to snap an ally back to his or her senses—mostly—with a word.
keywords:
Close burst 10

Trigger: An effect dominates or stuns an ally within 10 squares of you

Target: The triggering ally in the burst

Effect: The effect dazes the target, instead of dominating or stunning the target.
Practiced Mental Defense.trigger: An effect dominates or stuns an ally within 10 squares of you
Practiced Mental Defense.target: The triggering ally in the burst
Practiced Mental Defense.effect: The effect dazes the target, instead of dominating or stunning the target.

Root Understanding.name: Root Understanding
Root Understanding.flavor: Your studies in history have exposed you to a variety of languages, which sometimes allows you to understand a language in which you aren’t fluent.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You see or hear a language you don’t understand.

Effect: You can understand, read, speak, and write the triggering language until the end of the encounter.
Root Understanding.trigger: You see or hear a language you don’t understand.
Root Understanding.effect: You can understand, read, speak, and write the triggering language until the end of the encounter.

Natural Terrain Understanding.name: Natural Terrain Understanding
Natural Terrain Understanding.flavor: You alert your allies to hidden advantages in the nearby terrain, giving them an opportunity to shift the battle and defend themselves.
keywords:
Close burst 3

Target: Each ally in the burst

Effect: The target gains a +2 power bonus to AC until the end of your next turn. In addition, the target can shift 2 squares as a free action.
Natural Terrain Understanding.effect: The target gains a +2 power bonus to AC until the end of your next turn. In addition, the target can shift 2 squares as a free action.

Assurance of Prophecy.name: Assurance of Prophecy
Assurance of Prophecy.flavor: You call out choice verses of prophecy. The knowledge that destiny is on your side renews your ally’s vigor.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you spends a healing surge

Effect: The triggering ally gains 3d6 temporary hit points.
Assurance of Prophecy.trigger: An ally within 5 squares of you spends a healing surge
Assurance of Prophecy.effect:
The triggering ally gains 3d6 temporary hit points.
Level 21: 3d12 temporary hit points.

Serpent's Tongue.name: Serpent's Tongue
Serpent's Tongue.flavor: Your lie twists in your foe’s mind like a snake, allowing you to hide the venom behind your next words.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You fail a Bluff check against a creature

Effect: You gain a +5 power bonus to the next Bluff, Diplomacy, or Intimidate check you make against that creature before the end of your next turn.
Serpent's Tongue.trigger: You fail a Bluff check against a creature
Serpent's Tongue.effect: You gain a +5 power bonus to the next Bluff, Diplomacy, or Intimidate check you make against that creature before the end of your next turn.

Secrets of the City.name: Secrets of the City
Secrets of the City.flavor: You learn all the city’s secrets by keeping your ear to the streets.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You would make an Arcana, History, Intelligence, or Religion check in a settlement in which you’ve already succeeded on a Streetwise check

Effect: You make a Streetwise check in place of the Arcana, History, Intelligence, or Religion check.
Secrets of the City.trigger: You would make an Arcana, History, Intelligence, or Religion check in a settlement in which you’ve already succeeded on a Streetwise check
Secrets of the City.effect: You make a Streetwise check in place of the Arcana, History, Intelligence, or Religion check.

Damning Secret.name: Damning Secret
Damning Secret.flavor: Picking up on tiny tell-tale signs, you divine a critical weakness in your foe’s determination.
keywords:
Ranged 10

Trigger: You would make an Intimidate check against a target

Target: One creature that shares a language with you

Effect: You make an Insight check in place of an Intimidate check. The target gains the standard bonuses to its Will defense against Intimidate (+5 bonus if the target is unfriendly to the character, or +10 if the target is hostile).
Damning Secret.trigger: You would make an Intimidate check against a target
Damning Secret.target: One creature that shares a language with you
Damning Secret.effect: You make an Insight check in place of an Intimidate check. The target gains the standard bonuses to its Will defense against Intimidate (+5 bonus if the target is unfriendly to the character, or +10 if the target is hostile).

Faulty Memory.name: Faulty Memory
Faulty Memory.flavor: You spin a web of lies that makes someone doubt his or her own recollection.
keywords:
Ranged 10

Target: One creature that shares a language with you

Effect: You make a Bluff check opposed by an Insight check that the target makes as a free action. The target gains a +5 bonus to Insight if the target is unfriendly to the character, or a +10 bonus if the target is hostile. If your check succeeds, you make the target doubt its memory and believe your version of events.
Faulty Memory.target: One creature that shares a language with you
Faulty Memory.effect: You make a Bluff check opposed by an Insight check that the target makes as a free action. The target gains a +5 bonus to Insight if the target is unfriendly to the character, or a +10 bonus if the target is hostile. If your check succeeds, you make the target doubt its memory and believe your version of events.

Master Diplomat.name: Master Diplomat
Master Diplomat.flavor: Catching a possible faux pas in what you were about to say, you quickly adjust your soothing words and flattery to work more magic than the most powerful spell.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make a Diplomacy check and dislike the result

Effect: Reroll the Diplomacy check. You decide whether to make the reroll before the DM announces the result. You can use whichever result you prefer.
Master Diplomat.trigger: You make a Diplomacy check and dislike the result
Master Diplomat.effect: Reroll the Diplomacy check. You decide whether to make the reroll before the DM announces the result. You can use whichever result you prefer.

Spider Dodge.name: Spider Dodge
Spider Dodge.flavor: With your back against a wall, you trick your enemy into misjudging and striking the wall as you duck out of the way.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An enemy hits you with a melee attack when you are adjacent blocking terrain.

Effect: You gain a bonus equal to your Dexterity modifier to all defenses against the attack.
Spider Dodge.trigger: An enemy hits you with a melee attack when you are adjacent blocking terrain.
Spider Dodge.effect: You gain a bonus equal to your Dexterity modifier to all defenses against the attack.

Talented Athletics.name: Talented Athletics
Talented Athletics.flavor: You don’t always succeed in feats of physicality, but your failures rarely cost you.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You fail an Athletics check by 5 or more when swimming or climbing.

Effect: Treat the skill check result as if you failed by 4.
Talented Athletics.trigger: You fail an Athletics check by 5 or more when swimming or climbing.
Talented Athletics.effect: Treat the skill check result as if you failed by 4.

Kord's Force.name: Kord's Force
Kord's Force.flavor: Summoning all your training as well as your might, your effort exceeds what strength alone could gain.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You would make a Strength check.

Effect: You make an Athletics check in place of the Strength check.
Kord's Force.trigger: You would make a Strength check.
Kord's Force.effect: You make an Athletics check in place of the Strength check.

Strength Against Strength.name: Strength Against Strength
Strength Against Strength.flavor: You dramatically flourish your weapon after a failure to hit your foe, hoping the sweep of your legs and whirling of your arms will confound your foe.
keywords:
Melee weapon

Trigger: Your melee attack misses its target.

Effect: You make an Athletics check. If your result equals or exceeds the target’s highest defense, you can knock the target prone or slide the target 1 square.
Strength Against Strength.trigger: Your melee attack misses its target.
Strength Against Strength.effect: You make an Athletics check. If your result equals or exceeds the target’s highest defense, you can knock the target prone or slide the target 1 square.

Exemplar of Valor.name: Exemplar of Valor
Exemplar of Valor.flavor: You brace yourself against the terror inspired by a foe, and your bravery serves as an example to your friends.
keywords:
Close burst 10

Trigger: You are the target of an enemy’s fear effect.

Effect: Until the end of the encounter, you and allies in the burst that can see you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against fear effects. In addition, you and allies in the burst that can see you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls against the triggering enemy until the start of its next turn.
Exemplar of Valor.trigger: You are the target of an enemy’s fear effect.
Exemplar of Valor.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you and allies in the burst that can see you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against fear effects. In addition, you and allies in the burst that can see you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls against the triggering enemy until the start of its next turn.

Internal Reserves.name: Internal Reserves
Internal Reserves.flavor: Summoning up reserves of strength, you make a desperate effort to prevail.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are required to roll a saving throw.

Effect: You make the saving throw with a +4 power bonus.
Internal Reserves.trigger: You are required to roll a saving throw.
Internal Reserves.effect: You make the saving throw with a +4 power bonus.

Steeled Against It.name: Steeled Against It
Steeled Against It.flavor: Once stung by your enemy’s attack, you harden your body and mind against such future pain.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You take damage of a specific type or combination of types.

Effect: You gain resist 5 to damage of that type or types until the end of the encounter. If you already have resistance to that damage type or types, the resistance increases by 5 until the end of the encounter.
Steeled Against It.trigger: You take damage of a specific type or combination of types.
Steeled Against It.effect:
You gain resist 5 to damage of that type or types until the end of the encounter. If you already have resistance to that damage type or types, the resistance increases by 5 until the end of the encounter.
    Level 21: Resist 10.

Stay Back.name: Stay Back
Stay Back.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Stay Back.flavor: You sweep your torch or lantern around you to dazzle enemies accustomed to total darkness.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must be carrying a light source.

Effect: Until the end of your next turn, enemies in the squares illuminated by the light source you are carrying take a -2 penalty to attack rolls.
Stay Back.requirement: You must be carrying a light source.
Stay Back.effect: Until the end of your next turn, enemies in the squares illuminated by the light source you are carrying take a -2 penalty to attack rolls.

Foil Ambush.name: Foil Ambush
Foil Ambush.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Foil Ambush.flavor: Something out of place alerts you to imminent danger, letting you foil an enemy’s ambush.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You are surprised while conscious.

Effect: You are not surprised, and you are aware of the location of any enemy within 10 squares of you that is hidden. You then shift up to half your speed as a free action.
Foil Ambush.effect: You are not surprised, and you are aware of the location of any enemy within 10 squares of you that is hidden. You then shift up to half your speed as a free action.

Immersed in Darkness.name: Immersed in Darkness
Immersed in Darkness.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Immersed in Darkness.flavor: You know how to use shadows to stay concealed even from creatures that can see in the dark.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must be in dim light or darkness.

Effect: You become invisible until the start of your next turn, until you attack, or until you enter bright light.
Immersed in Darkness.requirement: You must be in dim light or darkness.
Immersed in Darkness.effect: You become invisible until the start of your next turn, until you attack, or until you enter bright light.

Cave Sight.name: Cave Sight
Cave Sight.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Cave Sight.flavor: You close your eyes, projecting arcane awareness to give you a mental picture of the cavern ahead.
keywords:
Close burst 20

Effect: You learn the general layout of terrain features in the burst. You cannot sense through solid objects, such as cave walls, but you do sense around corners and into narrow gaps. Additionally, you can make a Perception check to detect hidden creatures, objects, and traps as though you were within 10 squares of them.
Cave Sight.effect: You learn the general layout of terrain features in the burst. You cannot sense through solid objects, such as cave walls, but you do sense around corners and into narrow gaps. Additionally, you can make a Perception check to detect hidden creatures, objects, and traps as though you were within 10 squares of them.

Dungeoneer’s Guidance.name: Dungeoneer’s Guidance
Dungeoneer’s Guidance.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Dungeoneer’s Guidance.flavor: Your survival skills step in to support an ally.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An ally you can see and who can hear you makes an Acrobatics, Athletics, Dungeoneering, Nature, or Perception check and dislikes the result.

Effect: Make a Dungeoneering check. The triggering ally can use the result of your check in place of his or her own result.
Dungeoneer’s Guidance.trigger: An ally you can see and who can hear you makes an Acrobatics, Athletics, Dungeoneering, Nature, or Perception check and dislikes the result.
Dungeoneer’s Guidance.effect: Make a Dungeoneering check. The triggering ally can use the result of your check in place of his or her own result.

Elude Senses.name: Elude Senses
Elude Senses.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Elude Senses.flavor: You slip past the notice of creatures that have adapted to life underground.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Until the end of your next turn, creatures can’t use darkvision, blindsight, or tremorsense to detect you. You can be detected with other senses as normal.
Elude Senses.effect: Until the end of your next turn, creatures can’t use darkvision, blindsight, or tremorsense to detect you. You can be detected with other senses as normal.

Peer Through the Void.name: Peer Through the Void
Peer Through the Void.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Peer Through the Void.flavor: You part the veil between worlds, seeing creatures from the Far Realm as they really are.
keywords: Arcane, Stance
Peer Through the Void.effect: You assume the peer through the void stance. Until the stance ends, you gain blindsight 3, and aberrant creatures grant combat advantage to you. You take a -2 penalty to attack rolls against creatures outside the range of your blindsight.

Insane Logic.name: Insane Logic
Insane Logic.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Insane Logic.flavor: You abandon conventions of the world’s natural laws to break through an aberrant creature’s defenses.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Choose one aberrant creature that you can see within 5 squares of you. Make a Dungeoneering check to determine that creature’s resistances and vulnerabilities. On a success, your attacks ignore the creature’s resistances until the end of the encounter.
Insane Logic.effect: Choose one aberrant creature that you can see within 5 squares of you. Make a Dungeoneering check to determine that creature’s resistances and vulnerabilities. On a success, your attacks ignore the creature’s resistances until the end of the encounter.

Conceal Psyche.name: Conceal Psyche
Conceal Psyche.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Conceal Psyche.flavor: You hide the core of your identity deep in your subconscious.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to Will and a +4 power bonus to saving throws against charm and psychic effects until the end of your next turn.

Special: If you are dominated and a save can end the domination effect, you can expend this power at the start of your turn to make a saving throw to end that effect.
Conceal Psyche.effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to Will and a +4 power bonus to saving throws against charm and psychic effects until the end of your next turn.
Conceal Psyche.special: If you are dominated and a save can end the domination effect, you can expend this power at the start of your turn to make a saving throw to end that effect.

Timely Dodge.name: Timely Dodge
Timely Dodge.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Timely Dodge.flavor: Something out of the corner of your eye causes you to step out of the way of danger.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: An enemy targets you with an attack.

Effect: You shift up to half your speed. The triggering enemy can choose a new target for the attack if you are now out of range.
Timely Dodge.trigger: An enemy targets you with an attack.
Timely Dodge.effect: You shift up to half your speed. The triggering enemy can choose a new target for the attack if you are now out of range.

Ripples in the Air.name: Ripples in the Air
Ripples in the Air.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Ripples in the Air.flavor: You can navigate even in complete darkness.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You gain tremorsense 5 until the end of your next turn.

Sustain Minor: The tremorsense persists until the end of your next turn.
Ripples in the Air.effect: You gain tremorsense 5 until the end of your next turn.
Ripples in the Air.sustainMinor: The tremorsense persists until the end of your next turn.

Familiar Footing.name: Familiar Footing
Familiar Footing.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Familiar Footing.flavor: You are comfortable maneuvering around precarious terrain.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You ignore difficult terrain until the end of the encounter.
Familiar Footing.effect: You ignore difficult terrain until the end of the encounter.

Calculated Acumen.name: Calculated Acumen
Calculated Acumen.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Calculated Acumen.flavor: Your understanding of battle gives you information on your enemy’s tactics.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: Choose one creature within 10 squares of you. You learn the vulnerabilities of that creature, and it grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.
Calculated Acumen.effect: Choose one creature within 10 squares of you. You learn the vulnerabilities of that creature, and it grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.

Failed Diplomacy.name: Failed Diplomacy
Failed Diplomacy.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Failed Diplomacy.flavor: Negotiations are breaking down and will end in bloodshed. You realize this fact a split-second before your enemies do.
keywords:
Close burst 5

Trigger: You and your allies roll initiative.

Target: You and each ally in the burst

Effect: Each target gains a +2 power bonus to the initiative check. In addition, the target has combat advantage against all enemies until the end of his or her next turn.
Failed Diplomacy.trigger: You and your allies roll initiative.
Failed Diplomacy.target: You and each ally in the burst
Failed Diplomacy.effect: Each target gains a +2 power bonus to the initiative check. In addition, the target has combat advantage against all enemies until the end of his or her next turn.

Demonic Bargain.name: Demonic Bargain
Demonic Bargain.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Demonic Bargain.flavor: You call on a demonic entity to wreak greater destruction, but you tear part of your own mind in the process.
keywords: Arcane, Psychic
Demonic Bargain.trigger: You roll damage and dislike the result.
Demonic Bargain.effect: You reroll the damage and must use the second result. You then take psychic damage equal to twice your level.

Despana’s Stratagem.name: Despana’s Stratagem
Despana’s Stratagem.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Despana’s Stratagem.flavor: You watch as the battle unfolds and direct your party to gain the advantage.
keywords: Martial
Despana’s Stratagem.target: You and each ally in the burst
Despana’s Stratagem.effect: Each target does not grant combat advantage or provoke opportunity attacks until the end of your next turn.

Crushing Escape.name: Crushing Escape
Crushing Escape.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Crushing Escape.flavor: You smash free from your enemy’s grasp, sending it reeling and making it susceptible to your next attack.
keywords:
Personal

Trigger: You make an escape attempt using Athletics.

Effect: You gain a power bonus to your Athletics check equal to your Strength modifier. If you escape and a creature was grabbing you, that creature gains vulnerable 5 to your attacks until the end of your next turn.
Crushing Escape.trigger: You make an escape attempt using Athletics.
Crushing Escape.effect: You gain a power bonus to your Athletics check equal to your Strength modifier. If you escape and a creature was grabbing you, that creature gains vulnerable 5 to your attacks until the end of your next turn.

Enter the Crucible.name: Enter the Crucible
Enter the Crucible.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Enter the Crucible.flavor: Your body returns to the disciplined stance that enabled you to survive Cor Talcor’s crucible, giving you a ceaseless resilience to attacks.
keywords:
Personal

Requirement: You must have at least one healing surge remaining.

Effect: You lose a healing surge. Until the end of the encounter, you cannot be weakened, and you gain resist 10 to all damage.
Enter the Crucible.requirement: You must have at least one healing surge remaining.
Enter the Crucible.effect: You lose a healing surge. Until the end of the encounter, you cannot be weakened, and you gain resist 10 to all damage.

Iron Resurgence.name: Iron Resurgence
Iron Resurgence.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Iron Resurgence.flavor: Though your hands do little to comfort the wounded, you ensure that an injury will not keep an ally out of the battle.
keywords: Healing
Iron Resurgence.target: You or one ally; must be bloodied and have at least two healing surges remaining
Iron Resurgence.effect: The target loses a healing surge and can then spend one or two healing surges. The target also gains temporary hit points equal to half his or her healing surge value.

Scatter the Cowards.name: Scatter the Cowards
Scatter the Cowards.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Scatter the Cowards.flavor: The fearsomeness of your presence sends foes slinking away.
keywords:
Personal

Effect: You move up to your speed. During this movement, minions cannot attack you, and you can push any creature that misses you with an attack 1 square as a free action.
Scatter the Cowards.effect: You move up to your speed. During this movement, minions cannot attack you, and you can push any creature that misses you with an attack 1 square as a free action.
